Reviews.Title: bought it a week ago and..........
Reviews.Author: Amberly W. "SnapHappy"
Reviews.Content: its a little bigger than i expected it would be, but i'm very impressed with the Macro functions..for years i was using my kodak zd8612IS and the macro was...eh...at best...this..is out standing..i've taken pictures of rain drops on the windshield, my lizards eyeball in awesome detail and managed to get a cute shot of the freckle my daughter has in the corner of her eye, the flash is in a little bit of an awkward place i'm used to putting my finger in the top right corner ...where the flash sits, but i love the speaker/mic design and placement unlike my kodak i can be a foot from the speaker and give a chirp of a yell and it doesn't pick up so loudly it hurts the ears, ( i film alot of horses and riders so some times while i'm filming i have to ask them to try some thing new with this camera it doesn't sound like i'm YELLING..but that my voice is raised a little) i like the feel of the anti-shake module.it gives it a feel of almost being a super expensive camera, it fits in the side pocket of most of my cargo jeans which is convenient for me, my only quarrel is the shutter...its so flimsy i have already managed to reach into a pocket and unknowingly pushed the shutter open with my fingers and pulled it out with a finger on the lens, so i bought a carrying bag..i love playing with the picture editing software IN the camera (THE SOFTWARE FOR IT ON THE PC SUCKS..you're better off using windows live photo) the factory battery is great i get between 6hours of idle camera time (turn it on and let it sit untouched) not sure how many pictures as i haven't really tested it to its full capability yet, but i'm an intermediate level photographer along side my 2011 pentax k-r dslr camera, i love this little point and shoot just as much as my k-r if not slightly more for its small but efficient size...the panorama is decent, but its not the best at what my dslr succeeds in which is any thing to bright, sunsets and moon pictures dont fare well with this little guy unless you can jimmyrig a filter to the lens for moon pictures, but i found there's a horrible glare even with the iso at lowest OR highest, my bf knows a good bit about camera's also an intermediate level and he was baffled why the sunset mode isn't as great as he too hoped it was. the action setting is GREAT as stated before, i shoot lots of horse video's and pictures with the setting to take 10 pictures quickly (forgive my lack of knowledge of camera terms i just go by what i know) i can get the perfect picture set of a horses gait at ANY pace which is hard some times, while bored 1 night watching tv i decided to play with that function and shot the tv image i caught every 1/2 a second image for a good 2 minutes which led me to have i believe..30 images..flipping back through them it was like i was watching tv again. this is a GREAT camera to take on hikes, its quick to start up and is ready to go in a second or 2 so you dont miss out on that "shot to make the season" which for me yesterday was catching the flight of a bald eagle from perched position to mid-air flight...AMAZING quality of pictures.in short...this camera is GREAT for an entry to intermediate level for a hiker, biker, traveler, or just the stay at home mom wanting to catch those special moments to remember i DO suggest buying a much larger GB mem card though (you can get a 32GB on amazon for 30$s shipped, as i just ordered one) on a 4GB the movies total length is 12 minutes i believe in full 16MP. i dont think i'll ever get rid of this camera..and also grab a swiss gear medium size camera pouch with the hip loop from your local best buy for 16$s i think, and have a screen protector handy or a smudge free cloth b/c the screen (as with all lcd cameras attracts finger prints) this is THE BEST of 5 camera's i've ever owned and puts my dslr to its paces to be my fave. WELL worth the $$$$$$

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a great camera FOR the price. This is a GREAT camera. Period.This camera is a little bigger than most point-and-shoot cameras, but it's not as big as I thought. It's light. There are a lot of shooting modes and it's easy to use. I love manual focus and manual white balance.I recommend this to everyone whho wants a good point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Received as a gift...could not be happier!
Reviews.Author: Brittany Romeo
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for my birthday from my boyfriend for our trip to Mexico.  I have owned 2 Kodak's and 1 Samsung digital camera in the past, they in no way compare to the Pentax!!!The first thing that I noticed about this camera is the quick start up.  My previous Kodak and Samsung cameras took much longer to completely warm up before I could use them to take pictures.  The Pentax Optio RZ-18 is ready to go almost immediately after turning it on, which is an important feature, so you don't miss what you're trying to take a picture of!Next are the settings, which are excellent.  I typically leave it on auto, as it does a great job of adjusting according to the surroundings and light, but when I do set it to a specific setting, I find that it certainly does its job.  Video capability is great too, the microphone, as stated in other reviews, is placed in a strategic area on the camera, so you pick up sound, but it is not muffled nor is it too loud.  There is also almost no lag time (small hiccups) when taking video, something I've noticed happens quite often with similarly priced (budget friendly) cameras.The LCD screen is wonderful, bright, big, and crisp images show up on it for you.  I also did not have a glare issue, even in Mexico outside by the pool in the hot sun!!!  That is a wonderful quality as well!The buttons are a bit small, so if you have big hands or long fingernails, they can be a bit tricky, but overall have not been an issue for me.The battery life is actually quite impressive as well.  I took this camera with me from our resort all the way out to Cozumel and the San Gervasio ruins and took pictures pretty much the entire time, and it still had plenty of life by the time we got back.  I actually ran out of space on my memory card before the battery gave out!All in all, I am EXTREMELY happy with this camera, and plan to hold onto it for as long as I can.  I am by no means a photographer or even a photo enthusiast, I just enjoy snapping photos of memorable moments throughout my life, and this camera fits in seamlessly with my life.  I would highly recommend this camera to any one looking for an inexpensive camera that FEELS expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: Another great camera from Pentax!
Reviews.Author: R. Alexander
Reviews.Content: "Back in the days" I learned 35mm photography with a Pentax K1000, and still remember their classic ME Super camera and superb line of lenses. So, while looking to upgrade my old 5 MP digital camera, this Pentax model caught my eye - and mind.I "made the leap of faith" and purchased the Optio RZ-18, and wish I had done so sooner!Some experts have determined that 16 MP digital cameras take pictures that may be printed at 5" x 7" as good as 35mm film pictures at that size. I have plenty of 35mm nature photos on hand in 5" x 7", and took the Optio back to the same places and began shooting....I'm still a die-hard fan of 35mm photography, so please keep that in mind when I state that the Optio did BETTER on all the photos I took in my comparison test! I printed my pictures on a plain old HP all-in-one Deskjet, using common matte finish photo paper. Color, contrast, and resolution on EVERY picture were better than my 35mm equivalents, although that may reflect on the film lab I have been using.I doubt if the Optio would beat 35mm in a 8" x 10" or larger comparison, but still would have been acceptable for general use pictures at those sizes. But since 5" x 7" is my most common print size, the Optio has effectively replaced film for most of my shooting.What I miss with the Optio: number one would be a real viewfinder, coupled to the lens. The LCD screen on the Optio is a weak point, completely washing out when strong light is behind the photographer (where it should be, right?). Number two, the display on that screen doesn't do justice to the lens. I was happy to discover that my pictures showed more color and contrast on my computer screen when I was preparing them for printing, and they also printed better than the camera's screen would seem to indicate!Battery life on the Optio is so much better than any other digital I have owned (at least 8 or 10), that I still don't understand how Pentax accomplished it. I put the Optio away for the past few months, and looked at it to help me write this review; the batteries are still at 3/4 charge, right where they were when I put it away. Thinking the battery life would be like other digital cameras I have owned, I purchased a car charger and spare battery, but now don't think I will be needing them.My Optio has a quality feel to it, and user controls are intuitive; I barely glanced through the instructions. A beginner would appreciate the user-friendliness of this camera, and the more experienced photographer would appreciate the more advanced features the Optio offers.No, the Optio is not going to replace any good DSLR cameras for serious digital photography, but its' compactness and light weight make it the better choice for general picture taking. Now, if someone at Pentax could just create a viewfinder for the Optio, I might be able to revise my rating to a full five stars for this still excellent camera!UPDATE, 1/2/13: This date I installed a FlipBac accessory viewfinder on my Optio, and initial indoor testing of that device is favorable; images in the FlipBac were better in at least several cases than those on the camera screen. Please see my review of the FlipBac for more information. After using the camera outdoors in strong lighting, I'll update this review, but it being early winter that may be some time later!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Expect Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Sgtbob14
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Father's Day present. Pentax has had a great reputation in the past, so I thought that they still performed like they used to.  Alas, this is not the case.  Everything was great for about three weeks and then the camera would shut down immediately after turning it on.  I called Ricoh-Pentax and they told me to send the camera in because there was no fix they could give me, and until I prodded them, I was going to have to send it back at my expense, and it would take 15-20 business days to fix what should be replaced.  Well, that was a month ago, more that twenty business days.  They still have my camera, and I need it for travel next week. What is going on? How long does it take to fix a camera, or to replace it?  I will never buy another item from Pentax or Ricoh.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Susan P. Weiss "Perhaps"
Reviews.Content: The camera is just what I had in mind for all around photography and specifically for closeups for selling products.  Thanks for a great transaction!  Camera was shipped quickly and safely.  Would recommend seller.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot for Large Hands
Reviews.Author: ChubbyMonkey49
Reviews.Content: Got this camera a few days ago and my first impression is this is a great camera, it starts up really fast, takes pictures really fast, has fast auto focus and has very nice zoom.  It has lots of options to play with and the size of the camera is perfect for those like me with larger than average size hands.  I love it!  For the price it is an excellent buy.  I'm no camera guru but if you are just looking to take great pics easily and quickly this one is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: good camera with fairly low price point
Reviews.Author: reaper
Reviews.Content: i got this camera just before christmas 2012 because i wanted something less expensive than a dslr that still had a good optical zoom.pros: relatively inexpensive (less than $150 with the reduction)  small but not tiny so it fits adult hands pretty well.  18X optical zoom  big digital zoom (i think 130)  16mp, so great quality once you get used to being still and waiting a second for the camera to focuscons: will not focus between 3 and 6 feet for me no matter what i do including manual focus, changing the action settings ect..  not a big con and kind of fun but at 130 digital zoom the sensor moves the picture around like crazy even if the camera is sitting on a table, its fun and funky.  factory battery is not enough power. buy a wasabi that fits the camera (available on amazon and around $7ish ) the after market has more power and lasts at least for me way longer.for the price i don't believe you can do better. when i bought it i didn't see any negative reviews which is what sold me as much as anything.even with buying a couple of spare batteries and a 32 mb sd card the whole rig was about $150 that cannot be beaten in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Those far-away people
Reviews.Author: wags
Reviews.Content: I love the 18x optical zoom. I can take pictures of my family and friends even from across the yard, soccer field, etc. I like that it is small and lightweight and easy to use. Having a rechargeable battery is great, too.

Reviews.Title: Only good for a while!
Reviews.Author: PJR
Reviews.Content: Really liked the camera, and it took good pictures with lots of settings, but only after 7 months of casual use, we started having problems with the worst being, it always shuts down after trying to use the zoom option. Very disappointed and will be not buying another Pentax product for some time

Reviews.Title: Good camera at very grood price
Reviews.Author: Andrea Camperi
Reviews.Content: I already have a Pentax Reflex and haven't had any issue at all. I was looking for a smaller "sister" and I picked up this camera.Great zoom, great pictures and good quality in the video recording mode,  night pictures are not that good though(they came out kind of reddish if you don't change manually all the settings...).Overall, I would strongly recommend it for its price and its quality....

Reviews.Title: Good and bad, but worth it if you get a good price
Reviews.Author: Debra Ann Dargay
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because Costco offered it for $80 off.  I wanted a pocket camera with a good zoom, and it does not disappoint there.  There are a variety of modes to choose from, and the super close up is phenomenal for a small camera.  Very light weight.  Flash is iffy and you need to watch your fingers - you may be covering it.  You can buy a remote for it and take group photos and be in them.  Minuses for me = really, really bad panoramic.  It does not stitch the sections together seamlessly.  Also, the charger comes with a (too) long cord and is a nuisance for the traveler.  I ordered a plug-in charger and that is much better.  Overall, it does the trick for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight and faulty.
Reviews.Author: beeraylyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the great zoom.  Upon receiving it felt very light-weight and plastic. I turned it on once and everything seemed to be fine, but upon a second boot the display was covered in lines and would flicker on and off depending up on the angle that the camera was held at.  Had in my possession less than 24 hours before I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: R. Coleman "roncoleman"
Reviews.Content: I never found this camera satisfactory during its brief life.  Pictures taken outdoors with the zoom, utilizing various preset settings, were seldom sharp or crisp.  In bright light they were very washed out, almost gauzy.  Pictures that came out great would have come out great using almost any up to date digital camera. The form factor was also rather clunky.Then I took it to the beach.  Some sand got somewhere near the zoom lens, into the works, and that was it.  Trashed.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - excellent zoom
Reviews.Author: reviewer
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip to Europe.  It worked beautifully and took great shots.  The zoom was amazing and really expanded the versatility of the camera.  Others have commented about the camera housing.  I found it not to be an issue and it seems pretty well constructed.  I hope to use it for many years to come.  P.S.  I only paid $150 for it, but looks like Amazon raised the price to $215.  While pricey, I still think it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: This one is a keeper !
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace an Olympus SZ-12 that broke after two weeks. I have read comments about the cheap look of this camera, but if you get it in black, it actual looks pretty cool. I would also recommend that if you buy this camera make sure it is from KEH camera as they inspect it and give a decent warranty. I have taken about 100 pictures in the last week and I really like this camera.The pictures are sharp and the colors turn out well. What I really love about this camera is the display and the interface. The display is very clear and sharp. It is very easy to navigate among the various shooting modes, and the intelligent auto function works well. If you want a basic point and shoot with a great zoom that is easy to figure out (without running to the manual every time you use) it then this would be a good choice for you.  As far as a case, I recomend you call Case Logic and give them the dimensions of the camera. They will recommend the correct size case, and then you can buy it on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: a great little camera
Reviews.Author: V. Moore "Luv2CraftGinny"
Reviews.Content: It is super easy to use, maybe a bit bigger then some would like but it takes great shots.Ginny

Reviews.Title: Fills the bill with respect to capabilities and price
Reviews.Author: Jean Klimek
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what I was looking for as an upgrade to 7 year old Pentax Optio 5z.  It is easy to operate (very similar to my old Pentax) and will fill my needs.  The pictures I've taken to date accurately capture what I was looking at which, I suspect, is the major reason one takes pictures!

Reviews.Title: The camera works great!
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and works very good.  It arrived on time and we have used it a lot these 2 months.Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: paul52jazz
Reviews.Content: excellent camera, much better than my last one. great price, too. Able to fit in a shirt pocket. My only gripe would be that - without a grip - at first I couldn't figure out where to hold it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with many on-board features!
Reviews.Author: Michael Easter
Reviews.Content: Bang for your buck, that's what I'd say!  It takes great pictures and has lots of fun editing features that you can use within the camera--so the pix you download are ready to go!

Reviews.Title: best by
Reviews.Author: Dr.george
Reviews.Content: japan  made are ahead of had.you can use this camera all over the world up and hi  to the mounteens

Reviews.Title: Dark image cannot be fixed
Reviews.Author: Jia Liu
Reviews.Content: Image is too dark that cannot be altered.  Software is very difficult to use.  Not a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: To early to Rate it.
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: I had the Camera for only one week and it stopped working.I sent it back for repair.Contact me again in about 2 months.

Reviews.Title: MUY BUENA CAMARA
Reviews.Author: BETO
Reviews.Content: Me parece una muy buena cámara, aunque la opción Macro, podría ser mejor comparando con la opción macro de la Olympus, o Sony
